titleproper.value:
Guide to the Edward Isaac Lending Papers
                    <num>ALBA.068</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Wendy Scheir, October 2004

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T16:30-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Edward Isaac Lending (1912-2003) fought with the International Brigades in Spain and later served in the United States Army during World War II. This collection includes Lending’s correspondence with veterans (primarily dating from the 1970s and 1980s); writings, which include articles, letters to editors and typescripts for speaking engagements; as well as a small number of documents dating from the Spanish Civil War and World War II periods.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Lending died in Florida on September 24, 2003 at the age of 91.

A cross-section of Lending’s writings are represented here, including articles published in Jewish Currents, the Florida 
                <title render="italic">Sun-Sentinel, Horizon</title>and the 
                <title render="italic">Volunteer</title>; as well as numerous letters to editors. Other writings include a typescript about anti-aircraft battle that appears to be based in part upon a memoir written by comrade Jim Persoff (this memoir appears elsewhere in this series); and typescripts for public speaking engagements.

corpname.value: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade.
